intro: Acronema phaeosciadeum, commonly known as the dark-stemmed acronema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India and Southeast Asia. Acronema phaeosciadeum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky habitats.
